tweets.content: @ezeitler: At the #IODC16 open data research symposium, tr 2: open data in business. Qualitative and quantitative analysis of business use of open data
@opendatacon: Bring together the open data community and the business community. #IODC16
@DirDigEng: "Closed data favours outdated business models" #IODC16 #opendata
@OpenDataNation: Buenos Dias #iodc16! Let's talk about optimizing the business of government w data science. Deliver services effectively and efficiently.pic.twitter.com/vK3x9bxapZ

conference_notes:
The session, moderated by Amparo Ballivian (World Bank), brought together the perspective of private companies that are committed with open data. Some of the key messages were:
  • Richard Benjamins (Telefonica) : “There’s more value opening the data than keeping it inside the company despite the big challenges they faced while opening the data (anonymization, legal issues, competition, etc.)”.
  • Jed Sundwall (Amazon) : “Lowering the barrier of access to data, especially for large datasets, is tremendously powerful to unlock innovation”.
  • Carlos Fernandez Iñigo (Informa) :”Concept, context and interoperability should be part of a data standards”.
  • Richard Stirling (ODI) : “Data is an infrastructure for innovation”.
name: Open Data and Business
